column2: FLORIDA DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The total stopping distance of a vehicle traveling at 30 MPH is ___ feet:
2. What is the ideal steering wheel hand placement?
3. A bicyclist on a sidewalk or crosswalk:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to motorcycles.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.

column2: 4. You can be charged with DUI if you are found to be driving:
column4: while under the influence of alcoholic beverages.
column8: without your seatbelt on.

column2: 5. The towing connection between two vehicles:
column6: must not be used unless the vehicle is towing pipes or poles.
column8: must be longer than 10 feet.
column10: must not be more than 15 feet long.

column2: 6. The length of a point suspension is 30 days for:
column8: 18 points within a 18-month period.

column2: 7. Motorcycles are entitled to:
column8: half a lane on public roads.

column2: 8. When is it legal to pass another vehicle using the shoulder of a road?
column4: When thereâ€™s a vehicle in front of you in the passing lane.
column8: When the shoulder is unpaved.

column2: 9. Drawbridges are:
column6: special bridges reserved for car-pool vehicles.
column8: bridges found on roadways with 2 or 4 lanes.

column2: 10. What does this sign indicate?
column8: Parallel railroad crossing (side road)

column2: 11. _______  can drink alcohol and drive safely.
column4: People who are used to drinking
column6: Drivers who are 21 years of age or above
column8: People who drink responsibly

column2: 12. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Only right turns are allowed.

column2: 13. Drivers who dump more than 15 pounds of trash:
column4: must attend a Littering Avoidance Course.
column6: can be charged with a first-degree misdemeanor.
column8: will have their license suspended for 30 days.

column2: 14. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 15. Parking is not allowed within __ feet of any stop sign, flashing signal or traffic signal.
16. When children or school crossing guards are present in a crosswalk, what should drivers do?
column6: Yield or stop at the marked stop line and without stopping in the crosswalk.
column8: Enter the crosswalk while the school crossing guard is in the roadway.
column10: Stop after the marked stop line.

column2: 17. When approaching an intersection, drivers should:
column8: drive at the slowest speed while crossing the intersection.

column2: 18. An orange warning may indicate:
column8: A stop sign

column2: 19. In a heavy rain, tires can ride on a thin film of water, without touching the road. This is called:
column8: rainplaning.

column2: 20. If your vehicle enters water, it will float on the surface for ___________ before starting to sink.
column8: 3 to 5 minutes

column2: 21. All expressway entrances have three basic parts:
column4: Entrance lane, acceleration lane, deceleration lane
column6: Entrance ramp, acceleration lane, merging area
column8: Express entrance, acceleration lane, parking area.
column10: Passing ramp, merging lane, exit area

column2: 22. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column8: be aware possible hazards ahead.
column10: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 23. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column6: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 24. Passing on the right is legal when:
column4: when you are passing two truck in a row.
column6: the vehicle you are passing is making a right turn.
column8: you are driving above the speed limit.
column10: there are two or more lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 25. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column8: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column10: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.

column2: 26. At the time of arrest for DUI, you will be administratively suspended if you:
column4: fail to declare which controlled substances you have used.
column6: have a breath or blood alcohol level of 0.02 or above.
column8: refuse to submit to a chemical test.
column10: refuse to take a bus to go home.

column2: 27. The countdown time period of a pedestrian countdown signal is based on:
column8: reaction time and walking speed.
column10: how many people are crossing the road.

column2: 28. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 29. Which shape is used for advance warning of no passing zones?
column8: Octagon

column2: 30. Stop lines, crosswalks and parking spaces are marked by:
column8: yellow lines.

column2: 31. Wearing shoulder belts and lap belts make your chances of living through a crash:
column8: 1.5 times as good.

column2: 32. In what order can the 3 cars in the uncontrolled intersection proceed?
column4: A, C and B (red, yellow and blue)
column6: B, C and A (blue, yellow and red)
column8: C, A and B (yellow, red and blue)
column10: A, B and C (red, blue and yellow)

column2: 33. Which of the following is true about a driver who is convicted of running a red light?
column4: The driver may attend a basic driver improvement course in lieu of points on his/her driving record.
column6: The driver must complete a basic driver improvement course in order to retain the driver license.
column8: The driver will receive an insurance discount after completing the Substance Abuse Education course.
column10: The driver was in a hurry.

column2: 34. The picture shows:
column8: a no-right-turn sign.

column2: 35. What is the minimum required clearance a motorist must maintain from a cyclist?
column8: 15 feet

column2: 36. If you are involved in a crash and your vehicle enters water, you should:
column4: take off your clothes and shoes before trying to open the door.
column6: make every attempt to get out of the vehicle immediately.
column8: wait for the vehicle to sink and for the pressure to equalize before trying to escape.

column2: 37. A solid white line:
column4: means you should not cross the line unless you must do so to avoid a hazard.
column6: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column8: separates lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 38. More than half of the crashes that cause injury or death happen at speeds less than:
column8: 55 MPH

column2: 39. Which of the following is NOT correct. When making a turn, drivers should:
column4: not cause a pedestrian to stop.
column6: give a turn signal for at least 10 feet before you make the turn.
column8: slow down to a safe turning speed.
column10: always scan for pedestrians before starting a left turn.

column2: 40. A yellow light tells drivers to:
column4: increase their speed. The light will soon be red.
column6: go. The light will soon be green.
column8: stop if they can safely do so. The light will soon be red.
column10: yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 41. In Florida, there are two motor vehicle insurance laws. They are:
column4: the Car-Insurance Law and the Pay-In-Advance Law.
column6: the Financial Responsibility Law and the No-Fault law.
column8: the Social Responsibility Law and the No-Fault law.
column10: the Social Responsibility Law and the No-Risk law.

column2: 42. A licensed driver (Class E or higher) who is 17 years of age may not operate a motor vehicle between ___________, unless accompanied by a driver who is 21 years of age or older and holds a valid driver license (Class E or higher)
column8: 1 PM and 5 PM.

column2: 43. More than half of the crashes that cause injury or death happen at speeds less than __ MPH and within __ miles from home.
44. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 45. An open/uncontrolled intersection is one:
column4: where all vehicles have the right-of-way.
column6: without traffic control signs or signals.
column8: with four or more traffic signals.

column2: 46. When they see this sign, drivers:
column6: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column10: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 47. A center lane between lanes of traffic traveling in opposite directions may be designated for:
column8: left turns only.

column2: 48. Mature drivers should NOT:
column4: listen to loud music while driving.
column8: get power steering  when turning the steering wheel gets harder due to age.
column10: watch the entire road, from their front bumper to 12 seconds ahead of them.

column2: 49. If youâ€™re involved in a minor crash and your vehicle is blocking the flow of traffic, you must:
column8: take pictures of the scene.

column2: 50. A single yellow line marks the ________ of divided highways and one-way streets.
column8: right edge
